titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Danny Everitt collection, 1967-2018 MS 862
titlestmt.author: Norie Guthrie

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

Request access to this digital material (stored on Fondren Library's nearline / non-public server) by contacting Woodson Research Center staff at woodson@rice.edu. Please use the Identifier number in your request.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-17 09:52:27 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection consists of physical and digital material documenting the music career of Danny Everitt.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Growing up in Victoria, TX, Danny Everitt connected with music from an early age. Like others in his age group, he joined bands in middle and high school. Upon graduation, he attended the University of Texas and studied Radio, Television, and Film.

During his time at UT, he joined the band Dogfood. After graduation, he moved to Nashville to start his music career. While touring, he entered the Kerrville Folk Festival New Folk contest and became one of the winners of 1976.

Hearing about the music scene in Houston, Everitt eventually relocating there. He played both solo and in a variety of bands including the Danny Everitt Band and Danny Everitt and the Rhythm Tramps. Until the early 1980s he played in and around Houston and temporarily relocated to California.

Within the 1980s and 1990s, Everitt lived in Austin and the Nashville-area. He moved back to Houston in the late 1990s and has lived in or near the city fver since. Over the years, he has released a number of albums including "Fire Down Inside," "Acoustic Guitar," and "Dream Big."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of physical and digital material documenting the music career of Danny Everitt. The physical material includes song lyrics, fliers, posters, correspondence, and photographs. The digital material includes digital images and an oral history.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

Request access to this digital material (stored on Fondren Library's nearline / non-public server) by contacting Woodson Research Center staff at woodson@rice.edu. Please use the Identifier number in your request.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Items donated by Danny Everitt from 2017 to 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Danny Everitt collection, 1967-2018, MS 862, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Please see audio in the KTRU Radio records, UA 011.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the Danny Everitt, as well as any content copyright holders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents include low quality jpg images of Danny Everitt and his bands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents include: "Dimes' Worth," "Deserted Island Blues," "Rhumba Song (La La La)," "Go!," "Blue Texas Mornin'" - Acme, "Changes," "Half Is Spent Alone," "Love Me for Me," "Did You See Her Face," "Numbered Days," "Truth Lies"
